overview:
Hiroyuki Nishimura is the founder of two of Japan’s most popular, highest visited internet sites, 2channel, and Nico Nico Douga.

Nico Nico Douga lets users overlay comments on streaming video clips using an interactive third layer on top of the stream. It became the third stickiest site in Japan within one year of its debut in 2007.

2channel is an unregulated bulletin board that allows users to post and discuss things without identity or age verification or any log-in.

Nishimura is well-known in Japan for being a charismatic, anti-establishment leader. He created 2channel when he spent time in University of Central Arkansas as an exchange student.
